Package com.yardi.ejb

Interface SessionsTable

All Known Implementing Classes:
SessionsTableBean
public interface SessionsTable

  • Method Details

    • clear

      int clear()
      Clear the SESSIONS_TABLE.

      SESSIONS_TABLE database table is cleared when the application is starting to reflect that no users have logged in yet.

      Returns:
      number of rows deleted

    • find

      Sessions_Table find(String id)
      Find the single Sessions_Table entity that matches the given session ID.

      Parameters:
      id - Sessions_Table entity to find.
      Returns:
      Sessions_Table entity matching the given id. Returns null if the persistence context has no Sessions_Table entity that matches the given id and SESSIONS_TABLE database table has no row matching the given id.

    • findFull_Sessions_Table

      Vector<Full_Sessions_Table> findFull_Sessions_Table(String userID)
      Find all Full_Sessions_Table entities for the given user ID.

      Parameters:
      userID - specifies which entities to find.
      Returns:
      Vector of Full_Sessions_Table entities matching the given userID. Returns an empty Vector if the persistence context contains no Full_Sessions_Table entities matching the given user ID and the SESSIONS_TABLE database table has no rows matching the given user ID.

    • persist

      void persist(String userID, String sessionID, String lastRequest, Timestamp lastActive)
      Persist a new Sessions_Table entity constructed from the parms.

      Each parm corresponds to a column in SESSIONS_TABLE database table.

      Parameters:
      userID - specifies the user name.
      sessionID - a String containing the unique identifier assigned to this session. This value should be the same as HttpServletRequest.getSession().getId().
      lastRequest - most recent page that was requested.
      lastActive - Timestamp of most recent activity.

    • remove

      void remove(Full_Sessions_Table sessionsTable)
      Remove the given Full_Sessions_Table entity.

      Parameters:
      sessionsTable - the Full_Sessions_Table entity to remove.

    • resetSeq

      int resetSeq()
      Reset the sequence column in YARDISEQ database table.

      SESSIONS_TABLE database table is cleared during application startup to reflect that no users have logged in yet. The value for the sequence column is taken from YARDISEQ database table. Set the SEQVALUE column in YARDISEQ database table for the initial session.

      Returns:
      number of rows updated.

    • update

      void update(Sessions_Table sessionsTable, String sessionID, String lastRequest, Timestamp lastActive)
      Update the Sessions_Table entity.

      The given Sessions_Table entity is updated using the parms passed and then merged into the persistence context.

      Parameters:
      sessionsTable - the Sessions_Table entity to update and merge.
      sessionID - a string containing the unique identifier assigned to this session. The value should be the same as HttpServletReqest.getSession().getId().
      lastRequest - most recent page viewed.
      lastActive - Timestamp of most recent activity.
